AnalystsTest.Text:
12/11/2019 12:43:52 PM
The controversy around single-use plastic ban: Discuss the measures to find balance between Economy Vs Environment...

 Single use plastic ban is a controversy that is happening now in India mainly in Telangana State to bring the balance between the economy and the environment.Actually the intiation for plastic ban has took years ago across the world but it is not followed seriously by the manufactures and the users .

But due to deterioration of environment the government made strict rules to impose fines on the sellers so that the sales decreases and the users also gets awareness.

 As the polycarbon doesnot decompose quickly and takes years it is harmful for human beings plants and animals.It ruins the environment and reduces the oxygen content slowly.

But the plastic usage is very high and adding a huge profits to the economy so most of the companies are not letting down the business .The manufacturers are selling plastic in the form of bags,cups, bottles and boxes etc. The consumers are also showing high interest to purchase the plastic products due to low price and for its easy reusage.Single usage is not harmful for customers but problem comes in the decomposition process.But the customers are also not restrictin g to the single usage and going for reusage which reduces the economy as well as the consumers health.

The plastic is to be banned completely avoiding in manufacturing of some important products .The government should strictly impose the fines and the users should be aware of avoiding plastic which is good for environment.The government should advertise and create awareness so the consumers avoids using plastic and the manufactures will reduce there supply and eventually stops supplying.These measures can bring balance between the economy and the environment.

Title:Phablet Market poised for Explosion In Next Years

Phablet is a mobile tool which is a mixed version of smart phone and a tablet not only used for entertainment but also used for handling office tasks.In recent quarters the phablet is showing high growth in market share and according to the sales surveys in next years the market for phablet will explode. In 2013 the total shipment was 20 million but by 2018 that was exploded to 120million.

Phablet are manufactured with display size ranging from 5.5inches to 7 inches whereas smart phones are having screen display with 5 inches or less and tablets are with 7inches and above. Mobile video consumption is high across the globe so the key drivers prefer high screen resolution and excellent features which are the main features of phablets. So the phablets are user friendly.

In Asia and the other countries the market trend shows that the demand for phablets is at rocket speed which automatically decreasing the normal smart phones, laptops and tablet sales.

To drag the customers the smart phone manufactures are introducing the latest products new and attracting features and reasonable price tags in the last years.Sumsung Electronics is holding high market share and trying hard to make the smart phones cheaper around the globe but packed by the phablet rivals .The direct competitors for sumsung are Nokia`s Windows series Lumia,LG`s G series,Sony`s Xperia,Huawei,Panasonic, HTC`s Desire etc.The Nokia phones have windows 8 operating system while the android 4.4 kitkat and 4.2 jelly bean are used most of the other tablets.

The personal computer maker HP planning to launch the new phablets with 6 and 7inch categories whereas Apple the Technology gaint is ready to release iPhone 6 model this year.The near field communication facility Which are used in debit cards are now rumoured have in this `iPhablet`. 

According to the Accenture Digital Consumer Survey that is conducted recently in 23 countries revealed that in the developing countries there is a surge in demand for phablet.The demand for 5inch size devices is 65 percent in South Africa while 66 percent in China and 67 percent in India.In Germany, the market demand is 30 percent while 40 percent of consumers in United states are preferring to buy a phablet.




#################--Don`t Delete below content#################

Title: Phablet Market Poised For Explosion In Next Years

Phablet, a cute blend of smart phone and a tablet, is showing magnificent growth in market share in the recent quarters. Sales surveys project that phablet market will explode in next years and total shipment will exceed 120 million by 2018, from a mere 20 million in 2013.

Phablet is not just an over-sized handset, but an outstanding mobile tool for entertainment, as well as for handling office tasks on the go. When normal smart phones have five inches or less screen display, phablets have 5.5 inches to 7 inches display, while tablets have 7 inches and above. Phablets are more user friendly, with excellent screen resolution, and magnificent features. They are the key drivers in higher usage of mobile video consumption around the globe.

The market trend shows that the boost in phablet sales is clearly eating into tablet and laptop sales. In Asia and other developing countries the demand for phablets is skyrocketing.

Around the globe, Samsung Electronics continues to hold the largest market share for smart phones, however it is striving hard to fight cheaper, but feature packed phablet rivals. Nokia`s Windows series Lumia, Sony`s Xperia, LG`s G series, HTC`s Desire, Panasonic, Huawei, etc are direct competitors for Samsung. Smart phone manufacturers have been introducing new and improved products in the last years with amazing features and affordable price tags to woo consumers.

Technology giant Apple is said to be all set to release iPhone 6 this year. This `iPhablet` is rumored to have near field communication facility that are currently used in debit cards. HP, the PC maker is planning to launch two new phablets in six and seven inch categories.      

Android 4.4 kitkat and 4.2 jelly bean operating systems are used in most of the phablets, while Nokia phones have Windows phone 8.

Recently concluded Accenture Digital Consumer Survey in 23 countries has revealed that there is a surge in demand for phablets in emerging countries. The demand for the devices above 5 inch size in India is 67 percent, while 66 percent in China and 65 percent in South Africa. United States is also not far behind with 40 percent of consumers preferring to buy a phablet. In Germany market demand is 30 percent.
